intro: Torilis infesta f. bifrons, commonly known as the bifrons false thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial herb characterized by its hairy stems and basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it identifiable by its distinctive leaf morphology and flowering structure.
